unit.utterance: Ana katraus natrauswen ni Egun.
unit.utterance_translation: I want to tell a story about Nguna.

unit.utterance: Egun nrak pei, ipitlak natam̃ol kin naur Egun, nen Peter Milne ipakes pa.
unit.utterance_translation: On Nguna before, there was one of these men on Nguna island, where Peter Milne went to.

unit.utterance: Ipitlak natam̃ol, me ipitlak ntwam iskei ito. Me ito fam. Natrauswen tilm̃ori nen kineu ato trausi. Akano traus natrauswen psir.
unit.utterance_translation: There were people and there was a devil there. It used to eat. This is a true story I am telling. I cannot tell a false story.

unit.utterance: Nfaag ntwam nen ito fam. Ito fam pan me, ipan na kefam nmatu iskei, me nmatu nen itrau fag.
unit.utterance_translation: The story of the devil who ate. He ate until he wanted to eat this woman, but she had sores on her body.

unit.utterance: Ipitlak nfag nam̃olin Ina, "O, me ag kufag ag p̃afo pi temlaap kafei pam tenen kin aleka na naskon imalmal wi, kin me kafo inrok mai pamik."
unit.utterance_translation: She had sores all over her body. He said, "Oh but you have sores, you will be the last, I will eat the ones whose skin I see is clean and then I will come and eat you."

unit.utterance: Me nmatu nen ito. Ito me kipe mtaki maarik ntwam ne. Ito pan pan, ntwam ito gohed fam ito fam, ito fam.
unit.utterance_translation: But the woman stayed. She was scared of the devil. She stayed and the devil kept eating and eating.

unit.utterance: Nmatu nen ito pan imtak me ipitlak kori sees iskei. Inrik kori sees ga nen kin na, "Taksef". Rapa raru me rasef. Ramai mai rapalus mai, mai, mai mai mai.
unit.utterance_translation: The woman was scared and she had a little dog. She said to her dog, "Let's escape." They took a canoe and escaped. They came, they paddled and came and came.

unit.utterance: Ramaos. Rato sal namos. Raimer palus pan ramai sak esan rusoso ki Krikai. Rasak Krikai. Rasak pak elag ntaf.
unit.utterance_translation: They were tired. They drifted on the ocean. They paddled some more until they landed at Krikai. They landed at Krikai. They climbed to the top of the hill.

unit.utterance: Rasak pak elag ntaf, rato ntaf to. Me rato panpan go nmatu nen ito pan pan me ipitlak teesa iskei.
unit.utterance_translation: They climbed up the hill, and stayed on the hill. They were there and the woman had a baby.

unit.utterance: Ipitlak teesa me teesa nanwei. Rana ratkos to panpan go teesa ga nen kito to me plakori ga nen ruto. Teesa ga nen ito to pan panpan kaipi natam̃ol.
unit.utterance_translation: She had a boy. This boy and this dog, they stayed, then the child became a grownup.

unit.utterance: Me inrik mama ga ki na, "E, mama, me tkanwan kin ag kuto maet kuk p̃og tefla?" Go mama ga ina, "E me neu akano kuk aliat. Kakuk, akuk p̃og".
unit.utterance_translation: He said to his mother, "Hey, mother, why are you scared of cooking at night like this?" And his mother said, "I can't cook in the day. If I cook, I cook at night."

unit.utterance: Nlaken teesa ga ileka kuk ni p̃og me rupami p̃ulp̃og pami dina, me rapami kotfan. Me kefo mer kuk p̃og reki matool.
unit.utterance_translation: Because her child saw her cook at night and they ate it in the morning and they ate lunch in the afternoon.

unit.utterance: Ina, "Iku kin komam uto pam nafnag mlaanr?" Go mama ga ina, "Nlaken akano kuk aliat nlaken kin ipitlak ntwam iskei kin ito pam kit, nanre ni naur Egun".
unit.utterance_translation: He said, "Why do we eat cold food?" And his mother said, "I can't cook in the daytime, because there is this devil who eats us, this side of Nguna island.

unit.utterance: Kakuk aliat, kelek nuasog kefak elag kefo mai, kefo fareki Me ina "A, Me ikano mai", Teesa ga nen itli na, "Itik ga, ikano mai."
unit.utterance_translation: If I cook in the daytime, he will see the smoke rising, he will come because of it. And he said, "Ah no, he can't come." And her child said, "No, he can't come."

unit.utterance: "Kefo mai tfale?" Go ina, "P̃afo leka, kamer kuk aliat, me atli na, kafo tli na akano kuk." Go inrik teesa ga inrikin ki na "Okay, if wel kukano kuk aliat, upan upreg nas keskei".
unit.utterance_translation: "How will he come?" And she said, "You will see, if I cook in the daylight, he will come, but I say I won't cook." And her child said to her, "Okay, if you can't cook in the daytime, we will go and make a bow."

unit.utterance: Ina, "Kagaag preg nas. Kafo gaag preg nas." Ina "P̃afregsi nas, p̃aneu tua ki timen kelim." Aro. Timen kelim.
unit.utterance_translation: He said, "I will make you a bow." She said, "When you have made the bow, make me five arrows."

unit.utterance: Ale ipreg nas kina inom, bow, inom, aro ipa. Imer ga preg timen ilim ina, "Mama malfanen", Ina, "Malfanen kapreg, p̃akuk."
unit.utterance_translation: So he made the bow and arrows. He said, "Mother, I'll make it so now you can cook."

unit.utterance: P̃akuk aliat, me tufo nrogo. Malnen, ito, ikuk ina, "P̃afo leka p̃amer kuk aliat, p̃afo nrog ntwam kefo pes".
unit.utterance_translation: You cook in the daytime and we will listen for him. Then, she stayed, she cooked, he said, "You will see, if you will cook again in the daytime you will hear the devil speak."

unit.utterance: Me malnen ikuk panpanpanpan nuasog kipe pak elag. Inrogo ina, "O ey nap̃kas inom mees kafo pamwes." Kuleka?
unit.utterance_translation: And then she cooked until the smoke rose high. It smelled it and said, "Oh the meat is ready, today I will eat you." See?

unit.utterance: Ntwam nen kin ipios. Malen mama, ni teesa ina, "P̃anrogo, p̃anrog nalen. Itli na mees kefo pam kit."
unit.utterance_translation: The devil was calling out. Then the mother of the child said, "Do you hear, do you hear his voice? He says that today he will eat us."

unit.utterance: Go teesa ga ina, "P̃ata mtak mau." Me inrik kori sees ga nen kin na, "Takfak sanpe me tak-. pan p̃awelu wou me uta preg tp̃er. Kafreg fanis keskei, tp̃er keskei. Me kapreg, nana, nmetwes. Kapreg nmetwes me takfo pan kus tokos to."
unit.utterance_translation: And her child said, "Don't be scared." And he said to his small dog, "We'll go over there. I'll make a fence, and I'll put a door in it. I'll put a door in it and we'll go and hide in it."

unit.utterance: Ag p̃afo to etan na ket me kineu kafo tu elag, kafo tp̃a ki nas.
unit.utterance_translation: You will be down below at the gate and I will be above, I will shoot arrows.

unit.utterance: Ina, "P̃amer kuk." Mama ga ikuk go imer pios, "O ai." Imer ler ipakelag pan, "Mees kafo pamwes, apam̃or nap̃kas iskei.
unit.utterance_translation: He said, "You keep cooking." Her mother kept cooking and the devil called out again, "Oh, ai." He was coming up. "I will eat here today, I have found some meat."

unit.utterance: Me ito pes me ito palus, imai mai mai na isak elau Krikai
unit.utterance_translation: And he talked and paddled, he came and came and landed at the beach at Krikai.

unit.utterance: Go inrogo go ntwam nen imer m̃la. Im̃la pak elag, inag, im̃la a? "O ai." Ina, "P̃anrog kin imer m̃la. Nalen kin ipak elag.
unit.utterance_translation: And she heard the devil growl and call again. It growled loudly. "Oh ai". She said, "Do you hear that it is growling again. Its voice is loud."

unit.utterance: Kitli na kefo sak mai. Malnen ita pi twei mau go ipaakor ntaf.
unit.utterance_translation: He said he would land. Not long after that he appeared on the hill.

unit.utterance: Ipaakor ntaf tefla. Me ga itafnau kori ina, "Malen kemai ag kin p̃akati". "P̃akati." Me itli, "A, itik p̃ata kati mau me p̃aneu tao me kafo tp̃a.
unit.utterance_translation: He appeared on the hill like that. And (the man) taught his dog, "When he comes you will bite him." Then he said, "Oh, no, don't bite him but leave him for me to shoot."

unit.utterance: Kafo tp̃a". Malnen ina itp̃a ki timen pei ntwam itnoli. Itp̃a ki timen kaaru. Ntwam itnoli.
unit.utterance_translation: I will shoot." As he shot his first arrow the devil swallowed it. He fired his second arrow. The devil swallowed it.

unit.utterance: Kaatol, kaafat, kalim, itnol silua. Go inrik kori kin ikati. Kori ikati ikati panpan inrogsaki
unit.utterance_translation: The third, fourth and fifth, he swallowed every one. So he told the dog to bite him. The dog bit and bit until it felt bad from it.

unit.utterance: Natu iskasok skasok panpan inrogsaki natu kori isef pak elau ipa raru.
unit.utterance_translation: The leg jumped around because it was sore, he ran back to the sea and paddled its canoe.

unit.utterance: Isef pak elau, me itoktan to raru to me ito maag, ito lek napu teflan po leka mau, kori ifit paakor.
unit.utterance_translation: It ran back to the sea, it sat down in the canoe and it looked around (in fright). It was looking at the road as the dog appeared.

unit.utterance: Kori ifit paakor. Imtaki kori me isaiki raru. Ipalus panpanpanpanpan ga ito namos me imaos. Inpaki ki nawes elag na nakiat
unit.utterance_translation: The dog came running. He was scared of the dog, and he pushed the canoe, he paddled and paddled until he was on the ocean, and he was tired. He threw the paddle on top of the cross-wood (of the canoe) and he rested.

unit.utterance: Me ito marmar pan pan pan ikrokur. Kori kin iwat nrookot, pan pa pak natik raru ina, imtaki kori me imer ser, imer palus
unit.utterance_translation: He rested, then he was surprised. The dog had swum across to the side of the canoe. He was scared of the dog and he paddled again.

unit.utterance: Ipan pan na isak natkon Taalo, san kin isi pakes ina isal, isakwes. Ito marmar.
unit.utterance_translation: He went on to the other village, Taalo, the place that he went down to, he drifted and landed there. He rested.

unit.utterance: Ito marmar teflan panpanpan go ileka go kori ipaakor m̃eltig. Imtaki kori ifit. Ifit pak sum̃ ga me kutae, kros ni nmet ne, kros ne, ifit pak nmet ga go kros kaaru itan me ina itop po mer
unit.utterance_translation: He rested like that until he saw the dog appear close by. He was scared of the dog and he ran. He ran back to his house, but, you know, the top of the door. He ran to his door and the other crossbeam was low and he was tall and then.

unit.utterance: ito etan tefla me ito toluki esum̃, ki em̃rom. Me ito ler pak ektem. Ito leka teflan panpan me ilelkau kori me kori itap leg ki napu mau. Me kori, iur naor p̃otae
unit.utterance_translation: he was below, and he turned his back on the inside of the house. And he went outside. He looked and looked but he didn't see the dog, but the dog wasn't right on the road. The dog went a different way.

unit.utterance: Ilfek mai mai mai trau paakor natik nmet. Ipaakor natik ne tefla me ntwam ileka me ina kesok. Me isok, me ifrak.
unit.utterance_translation: The dog went around and came just to the edge of the door. He appeared at the edge there, and the devil saw him and wanted to jump. He jumped, but he was slow.

unit.utterance: Isok me ikrel nana, nkas ni kros. Trau tau sal tefla.
unit.utterance_translation: He jumped and grabbed the wood of the top of the door. It just hung there.

unit.utterance: Itrau sal itrau sal me kori iwokim kati panpanpanpan itarp̃ek. Ina itarp̃ek pak etan go ikatktof na
unit.utterance_translation: He hung there and the dog bit him and bit him until he fell down. When he fell down the dog bit off

unit.utterance: ikatktof, nana, ikatktof, nana,
unit.utterance_translation: he bit off, he bit off,

unit.utterance: pol, na, p̃ura ga. Ikatktof p̃ura ga. Ipo komkomki. Ntwam itarp̃ek kaimat pe.
unit.utterance_translation: his balls. He bit off his balls. He sucked them. The devil fell down and died.

unit.utterance: Me ini ntwam komkomki na p̃ura ga pa. Iolwe me ipan los nrookot. Ipan panpan pak elag Krikai,
unit.utterance_translation: And he sucked the devil's balls and went. He swam all the way across, and came ashore at Krikai,

unit.utterance: pan lek kano sees ne plak mama ga. Me ipak natkin teflan me ilai.
unit.utterance_translation: he went to see this small man with his mother. He went to his side and he spat.

unit.utterance: Ilai na p̃ura ni na ntwam ne. Me ina, "Ga ki. Kaipe katpuni.
unit.utterance_translation: He spat out the devil's balls there. And he said, "Here it is, I bit it dead.

unit.utterance: Malfane tupo ler." Kin ruler, gar rupak Egun pan kin go im̃ol im̃ol ipo mer ftomki natam̃ol.
unit.utterance_translation: Now let's go back." They went back to Nguna and it was healthy and would again have more people.

unit.utterance: Kin panpanpan kin mees nen kin natam̃ol rupo laap naur Egun. Tenen ga ipi natrauswen tilm̃ori. Anig teesa nen rutu trausi.
unit.utterance_translation: Until today when lots of people live on Nguna. That is a true story. I tell it to the children here.
